fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.annotation

Annotation Type RequiredClasses


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface RequiredClasses
    Indicates that the implementation needs some classes available in the classpath to be usable.

    The annotation can handle simple cases to indicate that the presence of one or several classes is mandatory for being able to use the associated implementation. In this case, use the value() attribute.

    The sub-annotation RequiredClass is used to indicate the following information:

    • One of several class must be present
    • One or several classes must not be present
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      RequiredClass[] classes
      Use this attribute to specify complex cases: One of several class must be present One or several classes must not be present For example: @RequiredClasses(classes = { @RequiredClass(value = "javax.mail.Transport", exclude = "org.apache.commons.mail.HtmlEmail") }) public class JavaMailBuilder implements ImplementationBuilder<JavaMailSender> { } Means that JavaMailSender implementation can be used if javax.mail.Transport class is present but can't be used if org.apache.commons.mail.HtmlEmail class is present.
      String[] value
      Provide the list of required classes needed for being able to use the implementation.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String[] value
        Provide the list of required classes needed for being able to use the implementation.

        If there is only one required class, a single string can be provided. It indicates that the class must be present in the classpath for being able to use the implementation. For example: 

         @RequiredClasses("javax.mail.Transport")
 public class JavaMailBuilder implements ImplementationBuilder<JavaMailSender> {
 }
        Means that the class javax.mail.Transport must be present in the classpath for using the implementation JavaMailSender.

        If there are several required classes, multiple strings can be provided. It indicates that all the classes must be present in the classpath for being able to use the implementation. For Example: 

         @RequiredClasses({ "javax.mail.Transport", "com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport" })
 public class JavaMailBuilder implements ImplementationBuilder<JavaMailSender> {
 }
        Means that the classes javax.mail.Transport and com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport must be present in the classpath for using the implementation JavaMailSender.
        Returns:
        list of required classes
        Default:
        {}

      • classes

        public abstract RequiredClass[] classes

        Use this attribute to specify complex cases:

        • One of several class must be present
        • One or several classes must not be present
        For example: 
         @RequiredClasses(classes = { @RequiredClass(value = "javax.mail.Transport", exclude = "org.apache.commons.mail.HtmlEmail") })
 public class JavaMailBuilder implements ImplementationBuilder<JavaMailSender> {
 }
        Means that JavaMailSender implementation can be used if javax.mail.Transport class is present but can't be used if org.apache.commons.mail.HtmlEmail class is present. 
         @RequiredClasses(classes = @RequiredClass(value = "javax.mail.Transport", alternatives = "java.mail.Transport"))
 public class JavaMailBuilder implements ImplementationBuilder<JavaMailSender> {
 }
        Means that JavaMailSender implementation can be used if javax.mail.Transport class is present or javax.mail.Transportm class is present.
        Returns:
        list of advanced class inclusions
        Default:
        {}
